summary: The Trump administration is pushing for an overhaul of the FEDERAL RESERVE BOARD, pushing for this as part of a broader effort to lower the inflation rate and lower prices. The DOJ has urged Federal Reserve Chairman Richard Powell to remove Lisa Cook from the board, which she insists she will not. The big issue is the ongoing pressure on Cook over her mortgage accounts and the perceived devaluation of her assets. The article discusses the potential impact of this pressure on the Federal Reserve on the economy and on the public and private sectors. It also discusses the implications of a potential tax cut in the future of the Fed, with ED MARTIN urging Congress to address this issue.
